ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a basic understanding of the Spanish language. As well, we covered some cultural topics of Spanish-speaking countries, which was very interesting to learn about.
Basic and widely used Spanish knowledge
I feel that I learned a lot about the Spanish language and culture in Latin America through this class.
I learned about the cultures of Spanish-speaking countries and I developed my grammar and vocabulary knowledge to the point where I can have a conversation with a native speaker.
I learned a well-rounded introduction to the Spanish language, complete with grammar and cultural relevance.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think that the biggest weakness of the course was how fast it moves. It is difficult to keep up with how much material is being presented, especially because we have the class every day. The asynchronous day was very helpful in going over what we had just learned in class and prepping for the next ones since we were moving so quickly. I do think, however, that having the class every day is very important. It aided my learning significantly to go to class each day and practice with other people. I think that placing more of an emphasis on learning vocabulary would be helpful in this course.

It is a bit difficult to enter this class as a student who has no prior Spanish knowledge because the professor only speaks in Spanish. Because I knew a bit of Spanish from high school, I was able to understand some of the things talked about in class, but I knew that some of my peers struggled.

The strengths include the fact that we have class almost every day which creates a routine for repetition and solidifying knowledge. I also liked the conversations we had to have with a native speaker every 2 weeks because we got to apply what we had learned and get comfortable with coming up with answers to questions we didnt expect.
The remote work day was very helpful in giving me time to prepare and catch up on course work. The small class size was also really beneficial in making our class feel like a community

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course if you want to learn Spanish.

I would highly recommend this course because it is extremely well-organized, and it covers writing, reading and speaking skills in Spanish. We have exercises in class that we have to do with our colleagues which fosters a collaborative environment.
I would definitely reccomend this course to any person interested in beginning to learn Spanish.
